components.name: Runtime
components.description: Generic bucket for uncategorized runtime issues

comments.body:
So i bugged Tony about this at tiConf NY. If you really have to have backbone version X >= 1.0 then do the following

create a directory at the root of your alloy project called lib.
then do the following

lib/alloy/backbone.js

clean and compile your project. congrats. 
I haven't ran alloy through all its paces to know if that breaks anything, but it didn't appear to break models (which was my motivation), nor views or controllers.

[~sophrinix] is right. The only thing I'm aware of off-hand is that it will likely break the sql adapter. We will try to work this ticket into a version soon, but this workaround should suffice in the meantime.
Yep. I tried to replace old backbone with new but it broke sql adapter.
This is resolved by ALOY-1074 and its related tickets (e.g. ALOY-1075, ALOY-1148)
